availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Sebastian C. Vick (Col, Hancock County militia)

body.p: Muhlenberg County, Kentucky, soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Mary M. Vick. Father of Felix F. Vick, John H. Vick, Wager H. Vick, Semaremus Vick, and Nancy C. Vick. Married to Nancy Whanger in July 1866. Carpenter in Muhlenberg County in 1860. Colonel of 71st Enrolled Militia in Muhlenberg County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Muhlenberg County, District 1, p. 62.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Muhlenberg County, Precinct 3, p. 5
S. C. Vick and Nancy Whanger, Kentucky, County Marriage Records, 1783-1965, Muhlenberg County, July 1866.
Annual Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky(Commonwealth Office: 1864) in Kentucky General Assembly, Kentucky Public Documents 1863.
